title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.22 - Electronic reporting of dispositions and scofflaws
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 91.22 - Electronic reporting of dispositions and scofflaws

State Regulations
(a) In lieu of
reporting dispositions to the commissioner, as provided in section
91.19
of this Part, the
commissioner may authorize courts to transfer dispositions electronically. In
addition, the commissioner may authorize the transfer of scofflaw reports to
the commissioner electronically. A scofflaw report is a report prepared by a
court that informs the commissioner of motorists who have failed to appear to
answer a traffic summons, or if after answering such summons, have failed to
pay a fine or surcharge. (b) Authorization to transfer dispositions and scofflaw reports electronically
shall not preclude any court from transferring such dispositions and reports
using paper dispositions and reports. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15
ยง
91.22

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
